ch.epfl.alpano

Class Panorama

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.epfl.alpano.Panorama

  • public final class Panorama
extends java.lang.Object
    A Panorma contains information about samples measured from the continuous models used. A panorama doesn't represent an image. A Panorama is 5 arrays that contain the following information: distance, longitude, latitude, elevation, slope . Each of these parameters are calculated for every sample.

    A sample is taken for every single pixel of the image that we want to create.

    The information that is contained within a Panorama can be used to create an image but this class isn't an image.

    Author:
    Martin Cibils (261746), Jeremy Mion (261178)

        public float distanceAt(int x,
                        int y)
        Returns the distance from the point of view of a specific pixel of the picture.
        Parameters:
        x - The horizontal coordinate of the pixel.
        y - The vertical coordinate of the pixel.
        Returns:
        The distance
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the index is not valid.

      • distanceAt

        public float distanceAt(int x,
                        int y,
                        float d)
        Returns the distance from the point of view of a specific pixel of the picture. If the index is not valid, it returns the default value.
        Parameters:
        x - The horizontal coordinate of the pixel.
        y - The vertical coordinate of the pixel.
        d - The default value to return if the index is not correct.
        Returns:
        The distance
